tariff.translation[0].definitions[0].def: a tax on goods coming into a country or going out of a country
tariff.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: The government may impose tariffs on imports.
tariff.translation[0].definitions[1].def: a list of fixed prices charged by a hotel or restaurant, for example for the cost of meals or rooms
tariff.translation[0].definitions[2].def: a list or system of prices which mobile phone companies charge for the services they provide
tariff.translation[1].definitions[0].def: a tax on goods coming into a country or going out of it
tariff.translation[1].definitions[0].exa: France and Germany imposed import tariffs on grain.
Canadian retailers said that higher tariffs in Canada compared with the U.S. were contributing to higher prices on some goods sold in Canada.
tariff.translation[1].definitions[1].def: a list of fixed prices, especially ones that change, depending on the time, day etc
tariff.translation[1].definitions[1].exa: Telephone tariffs are set by a government model to provide a 12% real rate of return.
